    People that have contributed to MTEX

    Ralf Hielscher invented MTEX in 2002 by implementing the pole figure to ODF inversion algorithm and leads since then the development.

    Institute of Mathematics, TU Chemnitz, Germany

    Ralf.Hielscher@mathematik.tu-chemnitz.de

    www.tu-chemnitz.de/~rahi

    David Mainprice contributes to the tensor functionality of MTEX.

    Geosciences Montpellier, France

    Ralf.Hielscher@mathematik.tu-chemnitz.de

    http://www.gm.univ-montp2.fr/PERSO/mainprice/

    Florian Bachmann contributed to grain analysis, the import wizard and the documentation center.

    Xnovo Technology ApS, Denmark

    Rüdiger Kilian contributes to EBSD and grain analysis

    University of Basel, Switzerland

    Felix Bartel contributes to spherical functions.

    Institute of Mathematics, TU Chemnitz, Germany

    Oliver Kent Johnson contributed the misorientation color coding.

    Department of Materials Science and Engineering, Massachusetts Institute of Technology, USA

    Bjørn Eske Sørensen contributes to spectral difraction and birefringence.

    Department of Geoscience and Petroleum, NTNU, Norway
